Explore visualisations with multiple sensors

In these two weeks, I made progress in adding more sensors and visualizing different patterns from basic geometric shapes on Processing. During the exploration, I have faced constant reconsideration in the concept as I also imagined how to make the interaction more interesting. I gradually finalized the idea of creating a textile interface that contains several mended touchpoints. With this idea, I am curious about the relationship between physical touching and digital visualisation that overlays on top of each other.

The learning so far:

— I got to practice and evaluate my understanding of coding, in combination with the Processing course that I am taking. I so far have used random() to generate unexpectedly interesting patterns out of basic shapes like rectangles and circles (Img 1).

— The process of working with soft electronic materials opens up my new interest, even though I have just scratched the surface of electronic textiles. There is something captivating in using soft materials to reimagine how we relate with the physical world.

Projection and what's next:

I used a white wall to project the visuals on a white wall (Img 2). Doing this gave a different perspective on the idea than looking at the laptop screen. Right now, I have two main visual elements: background and foreground. The background contains randomized patterns from rectangles and circles, while the foreground includes organic, expressive shapes. Next, I will need to move on with the construction. Then, I can continue fixing up the code, but without the actual fabric itself, it's hard to imagine what the interaction would be like.

img 1. Pattern attempts with the random function

img 2. Sketches of the fabric interface idea
